intro: Phalacrocarpum oppositifolium, commonly known as the opposite-leaved phalacrocarpum, is a rare and unique species of liverwort. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves, which gives it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rock surfaces or in damp forest floors. Its structure consists of a thallus with a central stem and leaf-like structures called phyllidia. This species is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological niche.
